parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the power steering system in cold temperatures can cause the steering wheel to become difficult to turn, making it challenging to control the vehicle, which can lead to accidents or loss of vehicle control.
symptoms: The power steering system fails to operate or becomes difficult to turn when the outside temperature is below 40 degrees
the steering wheel is hard to turn in the morning and evening
the steering wheel locks momentarily when turned left or right.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the steering rack can cause the power steering system to malfunction, leading to loss of vehicle control, which can result in accidents or injuries.
symptoms: the steering wheel becomes difficult to turn
the right front wheel breaks free from the vehicle.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the electrical system can cause a fire in the dashboard, leading to a potentially life-threatening situation. It can also result in loss of critical vehicle functions, such as brakes and steering, increasing the risk of accidents.
symptoms: control switch melts into the dash

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The intermittent stalling or hesitation of the engine can cause the vehicle to lose power, making it difficult to control, especially when entering moving traffic, which can lead to accidents.
symptoms: The vehicle hesitates or stalls when accelerating from a stopped position
the vehicle is difficult to control.
